intro: Eranthemum angustatum, commonly known as narrowleaf eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant, colorful blooms that range from red to purple. Eranthemum angustatum is relatively low maintenance and can be grown in gardens or as a container plant.
